name: Genghis Khan
what_did:
He united the Mongol tribes under his leadership and began a series of military campaigns.
His armies conquered vast territories across Asia and into Europe, building an empire larger than any before.
But these conquests were often brutal — cities were burned, and many people were killed.
why_matters:
Genghis Khan created the largest land empire in history.
He opened trade between East and West, helped ideas and goods spread across continents, and created new laws.
But his legacy is debated: he changed the world, but often through violence and fear.

questions.q: What is Genghis Khan remembered for?

options: Led brutal conquests across Asia and Europe
He united Asia and brought lasting peace
His empire connected East and West

fun_fact: Genghis Khan was once captured and enslaved as a boy, but escaped — and went on to become one of the most powerful leaders in history.
